---



---


## How to Run Hugo

**1. Development server (live preview):**
```powershell
hugo server
```
This starts a local server at `http://localhost:1313` where you can preview your site. It auto-reloads when you make changes.

**2. Build the site (generate static files):**
```powershell
hugo
```
This generates the static site in the `_site` directory (as configured in your `hugo.toml`).

**3. Build with drafts included:**
```powershell
hugo server -D
```
This includes draft posts in the preview.

**4. Build for production:**
```powershell
hugo --minify
```
This builds the site with minified CSS/JS for production.

**Note:** Since Hugo was installed to a temporary directory, you may need to add it to your PATH permanently. You can either:
- Run the install script again (it should add it to PATH permanently)
- Or manually add `C:\Users\spark\AppData\Local\Temp\hugo-install\hugo` to your system PATH

Should I start the development server, or do you want to run it manually?

<details><summary>Tool use: **command** • Run command: $hugoPath = "C:\Users\spark\AppData\Local\Temp\hugo-install\hugo"; $currentPath = [Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable("Path", "User"); if ($currentPath -notlike "*$hugoPath*") { [Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable("Path", "$currentPath;$hugoPath", "User"); Write-Host "Hugo added to PATH permanently" -ForegroundColor Green } else { Write-Host "Hugo is already in PATH" -ForegroundColor Yellow }</summary>

```bash
$hugoPath = "C:\Users\spark\AppData\Local\Temp\hugo-install\hugo"; $currentPath = [Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable("Path", "User"); if ($currentPath -notlike "*$hugoPath*") { [Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable("Path", "$currentPath;$hugoPath", "User"); Write-Host "Hugo added to PATH permanently" -ForegroundColor Green } else { Write-Host "Hugo is already in PATH" -ForegroundColor Yellow }
```


Hugo is already in your user PATH. Updating the current session's PATH so it's available immediately:

```bash
$env:Path += ";C:\Users\spark\AppData\Local\Temp\hugo-install\hugo"; $env:Path = ($env:Path -split ';' | Select-Object -Unique) -join ';'; hugo version
```

```
lect-Object -Unique) -join &#39;;&#39;; hugo version                                    
hugo v0.128.0-e6d2712ee062321dc2fc49e963597dd5a6157660+extended windows/amd64 BuildDate=2024-06-25T16:15:48Z VendorInfo=gohugoio
```

---



---


Hugo is already in your permanent PATH. It should be available in new terminal sessions.

**To use Hugo now:**
- In this session, Hugo is available. You can run `hugo server` or `hugo` directly.
- In new terminal windows, Hugo will be available automatically since it's in your user PATH.

**Note:** If you open a new terminal and `hugo` isn't recognized, restart your terminal application or log out and back in to refresh environment variables.

You can now run:
- `hugo server` - Start development server
- `hugo` - Build your site
- `hugo version` - Check Hugo version

---


The debug output shows Hugo is generating slugs with "..." at the end:

```
"/articles/its-a-love-story-baby-just-say-yes.../"
"/articles/lets-talk-about-george.../"
```

Windows doesn't allow "..." in directory names. Checking the titles to see where this comes from:


---

Titles end with "..." and Hugo is using the title to generate the slug, which includes "...". Windows doesn't allow "..." in directory names. Adding explicit `slug` fields to these posts to override the generated slug:

---



---


The original errors are fixed, but more posts have the same issue. Creating a script to fix all posts with "..." in their titles:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="write">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: fix-ellipsis-slugs.ps1</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 56, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,56 @@
- 
+ # Fix posts with &quot;...&quot; in titles by adding explicit slug fields
+ # This prevents Hugo from generating slugs with &quot;...&quot; which Windows doesn&#39;t allow in directory names
+ 
+ Write-Host &quot;Fixing posts with ellipsis in titles...&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+ 
+ $postsDir = &quot;content\posts&quot;
+ $files = Get-ChildItem -Path $postsDir -Filter &quot;*.md&quot; -File
+ 
+ $fixed = 0
+ $skipped = 0
+ 
+ foreach ($file in $files) {
+     $content = Get-Content -Path $file.FullName -Raw
+     
+     # Check if title has &quot;...&quot; and doesn&#39;t already have a slug
+     if ($content -match &#39;title\s*=\s*&quot;[^&quot;]*\.\.\.[^&quot;]*&quot;&#39; -and $content -notmatch &#39;^\s*slug\s*=&#39;) {
+         # Extract the base filename (without extension) for the slug
+         $slug = $file.BaseName
+         
+         # Find the front matter section
+         if ($content -match &#39;(?s)(\+\+\+.*?)(\+\+\+)&#39;) {
+             $frontMatter = $matches[1]
+             $closing = $matches[2]
+             
+             # Add slug field after title
+             if ($frontMatter -match &#39;(title\s*=\s*&quot;[^&quot;]*&quot;)&#39;) {
+                 $newFrontMatter = $frontMatter -replace &#39;(\+\+\+)&#39;, &quot;&#96;$1&#96;nslug = &#96;&quot;$slug&#96;&quot;&quot;
+                 $newContent = $content -replace [regex]::Escape($frontMatter), $newFrontMatter
+                 
+                 # Write back to file
+                 Set-Content -Path $file.FullName -Value $newContent -NoNewline
+                 Write-Host &quot;Fixed: $($file.Name) -&gt; slug: $slug&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+                 $fixed++
+             }
+         } elseif ($content -match &#39;(?s)(---.*?)(---)&#39;) {
+             $frontMatter = $matches[1]
+             $closing = $matches[2]
+             
+             # Add slug field after title
+             if ($frontMatter -match &#39;(title\s*=\s*&quot;[^&quot;]*&quot;)&#39;) {
+                 $newFrontMatter = $frontMatter -replace &#39;(---)&#39;, &quot;slug = &#96;&quot;$slug&#96;&quot;&#96;n&#96;$1&quot;
+                 $newContent = $content -replace [regex]::Escape($frontMatter), $newFrontMatter
+                 
+                 # Write back to file
+                 Set-Content -Path $file.FullName -Value $newContent -NoNewline
+                 Write-Host &quot;Fixed: $($file.Name) -&gt; slug: $slug&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+                 $fixed++
+             }
+         }
+     } else {
+         $skipped++
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ Write-Host &quot;&#96;nDone! Fixed $fixed files, skipped $skipped files.&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

---

<tool-use data-tool-type="shell" data-tool-name="run_terminal_cmd">
<details><summary>Tool use: **command** • Run command: powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File fix-ellipsis-slugs.ps1</summary>

```bash
powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File fix-ellipsis-slugs.ps1
```

<tool-use data-tool-type="search" data-tool-name="grep">
<details>
<summary>Tool use: **grep** • Grep for "^slug\s*=" in "content/posts/its-a-love-story-baby-just-say-yes.md" • 2 matches</summary>

Output mode: content


| File | Content | Line |
|------|------|------|
| `content/posts/its-a-love-story-baby-just-say-yes.md` | `slug = "its-a-love-story-baby-just-say-yes"` | L2 |

---


Removing duplicate slug fields from the files I manually edited:


---

Checking if the server started successfully:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="shell" data-tool-name="run_terminal_cmd">
<details><summary>Tool use: **command** • Run command: Start-Sleep -Seconds 3; $response = try { Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "http://localhost:1313" -TimeoutSec 2 -UseBasicParsing; $true } catch { $false }; if ($response) { Write-Host "Hugo server is running successfully on http://localhost:1313" -ForegroundColor Green } else { Write-Host "Server may still be starting or there's an issue" -ForegroundColor Yellow }</summary>

```bash
Start-Sleep -Seconds 3; $response = try { Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "http://localhost:1313" -TimeoutSec 2 -UseBasicParsing; $true } catch { $false }; if ($response) { Write-Host "Hugo server is running successfully on http://localhost:1313" -ForegroundColor Green } else { Write-Host "Server may still be starting or there's an issue" -ForegroundColor Yellow }
```
</details>
</tool-use>

---

_**User (2025-12-01 22:47Z)**_

iT's running

---

_**Agent (model default, mode Agent)**_



---


Hugo server is running.

**Summary of what was fixed:**

The issue was that Hugo was generating slugs with "..." (ellipsis) from post titles that ended with "...". Windows doesn't allow "..." in directory names, which caused the build errors.

**Solution:**
- Added explicit `slug` fields to all 18 posts with "..." in their titles
- The slugs now use the filename (without extension) instead of the title, avoiding the "..." character
- Created a script (`fix-ellipsis-slugs.ps1`) that can be reused if needed

Your Hugo site should now be accessible at `http://localhost:1313` and will automatically reload when you make changes to your content.

You can now:
- View your site in the browser
- Edit content and see changes live
- Build the site with `hugo` (without `server`) to generate static files in the `_site` directory

If you need anything else, let me know.

---
